patterns: Do you have any books by a particular author or in a certain genre?
fantasy
fiction
What kind of books do you have
what books are available.
what kind of books can i find
give me information about the books.
responses: Can you please give me some information about your interests or what course-book you are looking for? It will help me make a more better recommendation for you.

patterns: how can you help me,help me
help
responses: Hello, My name is VESITbot-your library friend.You can ask for any information about the library from me. Happy to help :)

patterns: Can I reserve a study room in the library?
How to reserve a study room in the library?
responses: Yes, you can reserve a study room in the library online by visiting our website https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library or by calling the reference desk at (insert phone number). Please note that study rooms are subject to availability and may have different reservation policies.

You can reserve a study room in the library online by visiting our website or by calling the reference desk at (insert phone number). Please note that study rooms are subject to availability and may have different reservation policies.

patterns: Where can I find books on a specific topic?
responses: You can use our online catalog https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library#pyqp to search for books on a specific topic by using keywords, author names, or subject headings. Alternatively, you can ask a librarian for assistance in locating books on a specific topic.

patterns: Is there an online library?
How to access online library?
How can I access the library's e-books?
responses: You can access the library's online databases by logging into your library account online or by visiting the library's website https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library and clicking on the 'Digital Library' tab. If you need assistance with accessing or using any of our online resources, please contact the reference desk at (insert phone number).

patterns: How can I renew my library books?
What is the process to renew library books?
responses: You can renew your library books by calling the circulation desk at (insert phone number). Please note that renewal limits and loan periods may vary depending on the type of material borrowed.

patterns: What is the library's phone number?
responses: The library's phone number is (insert phone number).

patterns: What are the library's policies on borrowing books?
What are the library's policies on borrowing materials for off-campus use?
Is there a limit to how many books I can check out at once?
responses:
The library's policies on borrowing books are as follows:Students can borrow 2 books for 7 days.
Faculty can borrow 5 books per subject.Students can also take the reference book/s for overnight study after library timings with librarian permission and should return next day morning.
Readers are responsible for books issued against their names.
Library reserves the right to recall any issued books even before the due date.
Borrowers must satisfy about the physical condition of the books before borrowing otherwise they will be held responsible for any damage later or at the time return.
Please visit our website https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library or ask a librarian for more information.

patterns: Can I access the library's Wi-Fi?
How to access library wifi?
get wifi
responses: The library provides free Wi-Fi access to all users. Please ask a librarian for the password.

patterns: How can I request a book that is not available in the library?
How to request unavailable books?
responses: Sorry,there is no facility for requesting books which are not available.Please visit our website https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library for future updates.

patterns: How can I donate books to the library?
How to donate books to the college?
donate books
responses: You can donate books to the library by bringing them to the circulation desk or by contacting the library's administration office phone.

patterns: What are the library's policies on overdue books?
responses: The fine on overdue books is Rs.2 per day. Please visit our website https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library or ask a librarian for more information.

patterns: What are the library's hours during exam week?
How to borrow books during exams?
responses: During exam week, the library is open from 9:00 am to 07:00 pm.

patterns: How can I reserve a computer in the library?
How to reserve a computer?
responses: You can reserve a computer in the library only by visiting the library.There is no on-line facility for reserving a computer.

patterns: How can I a library card if i lost mine?
how do i get library card if i have lost it?
responses: You can obtain a lost library card by visiting the circulation desk and presenting a valid form of identification.

patterns: Can I access the library's archives and special collections?
responses: The library's archives and special collections can be accessed online by visiting our website 'https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library#journals' or by booking an appointment for hardcopies.

patterns: What are the library's policies on lost or damaged books?
responses:
The library's policies on lost or damaged books are as follows :
In case a Reader loses a book he/she should replace the book.
In case the book cannot be replaced, the current price of the book and an additional charge of Rs. 20/- as processing charges will have to be paid. Please visit our website or ask a librarian for more information.

patterns: How can I suggest a book or resource for the library to acquire?
How to give suggestions to the library
responses: You can suggest a book or resource for the library to acquire by filling out a suggestion form by asking a librarian for assistance.

patterns: What are the library's policies on fines and fees?
How to pay fine?
responses: The library's policies on fines and fees are : Fine on overdue books is Rs.2 per day.You have to pay the fine via online mode only. Please visit our website https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library or ask a librarian for more information.

patterns: How can I find out if the library has a specific journal or magazine?
responses: Newspapers and Periodicals are issued against ID cards for Reading in the Reading Room. Bound volumes of journals will be issued for current reading.

patterns: What are the library's policies on noise levels?
is sound allowed?
responses: The library is a noise-free public room.Please try to be as silent as possible so that other readers are not disturbed.

patterns: What are the library's policies on using library computers?
Rules on use of computers.
responses:
Following points must be kept in mind while using a computer :Computers in the library premises should be used for academic purpose only.
Online chatting, browsing of social networking sites is strictly prohibited.
Playing games on computers is strictly prohibited in the entire library premises.
Readers not allowed to share their ID and password with other students.
Changing the settings and display of the computers kept in the Library is not allowed.
Readers should not remove/unplug computer cables/connections,network cables and other peripherals/accessories in the library.
Personal keyboard, mouse, headphones etc. are not allowed inside the library.
Students must take care of their Pen drives, CD/DVD ROMs, mobiles and wallets etc

is there a fine for late book return?
what is the penalty charges?
why is fine taken?
why is there is a penalty system?
responses: Yes,the penalty charges are 2₹ per extra day
Yes,the fine charges are 2₹ per extra day
the penalty charges are 2₹ per extra day
Fine is taken so that the book are returned in given time limit
penalty is charged so that the book are returned in given time limit

patterns: I don't have a library account
How can I create a library account?
Can I create a library account online?
responses: No problem! You can create a library account by visiting the library in person and filling out a registration form. Once you have a library account, you can check out books using our self-checkout kiosks.

patterns: What are the library hours?
When is the library open?
What are your hours of operation?
timings of the library
when does the library open
responses: Our library is open from Monday to Saturday, from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. However, please note that the library may have different hours during holidays and exam periods. It's always a good idea to check our website or call us ahead of time to confirm our hours.

patterns: What is the name of the library?
What is the official name of the library?
responses: The name of our library is VESIT Library.
The official name of our library is VES Institute of Technology Library.

patterns: What plagarism checker is used in the library?
check accuracy of report
how to check plagiarism
check if report is copied
fake
responses: Turnitin plagarism checker is used in the library.

patterns: What are the rules of the library?
What can and can't I do in the library?
Are there any guidelines I should follow in the library?
responses:
Some of our library guidelines include:
 please keep noise levels to a minimum, no food or drink allowed
, please do not reshelve books as they are arranged in a specific order
 please be respectful of others in the library.
 If you have any questions about library rules or guidelines, please feel free to ask the librarian or visit our website.

how to get previous year question papers
get pyq
what are previous question papers
responses: You can access the previous year question papers through our website : https://vesit.ves.ac.in/library#pyqp

chairperson

patterns: who are committee members
Who are the committee members of this library?
members of library
responses: The committee members are:1)Dr. M. Vijayalakshmi,2)Mrs. Kadambari Sharma,3)Mrs. Amrita Jhaveri,4) Mrs. Pooja Nagdev,5)Dr. ( Mrs.) Ranjan Bala Jain,6) Ms. Vinita Mishra,7) Mr. Vivek Umrikar,8) Mrs. Monali Rajput,9)Ms. Meenakshi Tyagi.

patterns: What is book bank scheme?
tell book bank scheme
responses: Book bank facilities available only for SC & ST Scholarship Students under Book Bank Scheme of Special District Social Welfare Officer, Mumbai City. Each semester in the academic year, sets of books are given to the SC & ST Scholarship Students.The students are requested to fill up a form for the book bank at the beginning of the Academic Year and submit it to the Librarian Students are required to handle books and reading material very carefully. Marking on library books with pencil or ink, tearing the pages or spoiling the same in any other way will be viewed very seriously. In such a case, the last reader will be held responsible unless he shows the Librarian at the time of issue that the book had been previously marked or damaged. In the event of damage of any kind, the last reader will be liable to compensate for damage.In case a Reader loses a book he/she should replace the book. In case the book cannot be replaced the current price of the book will have to be paid.

patterns: what are events conducted in the library?
events
workshop
responses: In VESIT, National Librarian Day is celebrated every year on 12 th August and also “VACHAN PRERNA DIVAS” is celebrated on 15th October 2015. It introduced a new scheme for VESIT students, known as Book Bank Scheme. The committee members, Mrs. Kadambari and Dr. Ranjan Bala were present on the occasion. The Principal, Dr. (Mrs.)J.M.Nair along with other committee staffs distributed the books to the members. On the same day, library distributed the BEST USER certificates to the students of Academic year 2014-15. E-Book demo session was held on 28th September, 2015 by Pearson and TMH publishers. First session was demo lecture given by Mr. Netwane, from TMH publishers and also solved the query of the staff members. The other session was e-book demo lecture given by Mr. Siddhesh from Pearson publishers.

patterns: what is the speciality of the library?
what is the uniqueness of the library?
speciality
responses: there are two schemes that is unique in our library:1)Book bank scheme,2)Promotion Scheme
there are three schemes that is unique in our library:1)Book bank scheme,2)Promotion Scheme

patterns: what is promotion scheme
what is meaning of best user?
responses: An understanding of students and how they learn is essential in developing Institution. Library and Information services of Technical institutions play a central role in enhancing the quality of academic and research environment. To meet the end users demands effectively the libraries need to identify and adopt practices and benchmarks. Thus we started to practice of declaring “BEST USERS” every month from the year 2013.

An understanding of students and how they learn is essential in developing Institution. Library and Information services of Technical institutions play a central role in enhancing the quality of academic and research environment. To meet the end users demands effectively the libraries need to identify and adopt practices and benchmarks. Thus we started to practice of declaring “BEST USERS” every month from the year 2013.

patterns: what books do you have for Computer engineering branch?
Can you recommend a book on computer architecture?
Do you have any books on computer database systems?
Where can I find information on computer security and cryptography?
Can you recommend a book on computer programming and algorithms?
Can you recommend a book on computer-assisted language learning and natural language processing?
responses:
Here are the available books for Computer Engineering branch:
First Year :
1. Computer Organization and Design: The Hardware/Software Interface by David A. Patterson and John L. Hennessy
2. Introduction to Algorithms by Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, and Clifford Stein
3. Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications by Kenneth H. Rosen
Second Year:
1. Computer Organization and Architecture: Designing for Performance by William Stallings
2. Data Structures and Algorithms by Mark Allen Weiss
 3. Computer Systems: A Programmer's Perspective by Randal E. Bryant and David R. O'Hallaron
4. Computer Architecture: A Quantitative Approach by John L. Hennessy and David A. Patterson
Third Year :
1. Computer Networks: A Systems Approach by Larry L. Peterson and Bruce S. Davie
2. Database Systems: The Complete Book by Hector Garcia-Molina, Jeffrey D. Ullman, and Jennifer Widom
3. Computer Graphics: Principles and Practice in C by James D. Foley, Andries van Dam, Steven K. Feiner, and John F. Hughes
Fourth Year:
1. Introduction to Embedded Systems: Using ANSI C and the Arduino Development Environment by David J. Russell
2. Distributed Systems: Principles and Paradigms by Andrew S. Tanenbaum and Maarten Van Steen
3. Computer Vision: Algorithms and Applications by Richard Szeliski

patterns: what books do you have for Electrical engineering branch?
What books do you have on electrical circuits and systems?
Can you suggest a book on electromagnetics and electromagnetic fields?
Do you have any books on electric vehicles and transportation systems?
Can you recommend a book on electrical safety and standards?
responses:
Here are the available books for Computer Engineering branch:
First Year :
1. Fundamentals of Electric Circuits by Charles K. Alexander and Matthew N. O. Sadiku
2. Engineering Electromagnetics by William H. Hayt Jr. and John A. Buck
3. Introduction to Electric Power Systems by Mohamed E. El-Hawary
Second Year:
1.  Electronic Devices and Circuit Theory by Robert L. Boylestad and Louis Nashelsky
2.  Network Analysis by M.E. Van Valkenburg
3. Signals and Systems by Alan V. Oppenheim, Alan S. Willsky, and S. Hamid Nawab
Third Year:
1. Electronics Fundamentals: Circuits, Devices & Applications by Thomas L. Floyd and David M. Buchla
2.  Signals and Systems by Alan V. Oppenheim, Alan S. Willsky, and S. Hamid Nawab
3. Electric Machines and Drives: Principles, Control, Modeling, and Simulation by Shaahin Filizadeh
4. Power Electronics: Converters, Applications, and Design by Ned Mohan, Tore M. Undeland, and William P. Robbins

patterns: what books do you have for civil engineering branch?
Can you recommend some civil engineering books that cover the basics of structural analysis?
What civil engineering books do you have that cover the design and analysis of reinforced concrete structures?
responses:
Here are the available books for Civil Enginnering branch:
First Year :
1. Engineering Mechanics: Statics and Dynamics' by Hibbeler, R. C.
2. Materials Science and Engineering: An Introduction' by William D. Callister Jr. and David G. Rethwisch
3. Surveying: Principles and Applications' by Barry Kavanagh and Tom Mastin
Second Year:
1. Structural Analysis' by R.C. Hibbeler
2. Soil Mechanics and Foundations' by Muni Budhu
3. Transportation Infrastructure Engineering: A Multimodal Integration' by Lester A. Hoel, Nicholas J. Garber, and Adel W. Sadek
4. Principles of Geotechnical Engineering' by Braja M. Das and Khaled Sobhan
Third Year:
1. Design of Concrete Structures' by Arthur H. Nilson, David Darwin, and Charles W. Dolan
2. Steel Design' by William T. Segui
3. Foundation Design: Principles and Practices' by Donald P. Coduto
4. Water and Wastewater Engineering' by Mackenzie L. Davis and Susan J. Masten
Fourth Year :
1.Structural Steel Design' by Jack C. McCormac and Stephen F. Csernak
2. Design of Prestressed Concrete' by Arthur H. Nilson
3. Construction Methods and Management' by S. W. Nunnally
4. Transportation Engineering: An Introduction' by C. Jotin Khisty and B. Kent Lall

responses:

1.  Fundamentals of Instrumentation and Measurement by Dominique Placko

Second Year:

Third Year:

Fourth Year:

3. Industrial Instrumentation and Control Systems II by William C. Dunn
4. Measurement and Instrumentation: Theory and Application by Alan S. Morris
